Hello,

@yaycwars

Just drag & drop the crack to the folder specified in the "# Installation Guide.txt" and then choose "Replace" on the pop-up that appears, telling you the files already exist.

@zomie

That problems occur to almost Ã©veryone, even to people with a legal version of the game. It's a bug in the game. You'll need to wait for EA to update the game. When the new update comes out, just apply this fix to get the latest version of the game: http://games4theworld.bestgoo.com/t916-the-sims-medieval-ultimate-fix-should-fix-most-of-your-problems

They're working hard on it.

@Tenoke

Yes, that's possible, but then you'll need to convert the Crack (.exe file) to a format that is also used in Mac's, using some software.
After you've done that, just copy the converted file(s) to: Contents/Resources/trangaming/c_Drive/Program Files/Electronic Arts/The Sims 3 Outdoor Living Stuff/Game/Bin/      
and choose "Replace" on the pop-up that appears, telling you the files already exist.
